00043 __BEGIN_DECLS
00044 
00045 /* Get machine-dependent HUGE_VAL value (returned on overflow).
00046    On all IEEE754 machines, this is +Infinity.  */
00047 #include <bits/huge_val.h>
00048 
00049 /* Get machine-dependent NAN value (returned for some domain errors).  */
00050 #ifdef   __USE_ISOC99
00051 # include <bits/nan.h>
00052 #endif
00053 /* Get general and ISO C99 specific information.  */
00054 #include <bits/mathdef.h>
00055 
00056 
00057 /* The file <bits/mathcalls.h> contains the prototypes for all the
00058    actual math functions.  These macros are used for those prototypes,
00059    so we can easily declare each function as both `name' and `__name',
00060    and can declare the float versions `namef' and `__namef'.  */
00061 
00062 #define __MATHCALL(function,suffix, args)       \
00063   __MATHDECL (_Mdouble_,function,suffix, args)
00064 #define __MATHDECL(type, function,suffix, args) \
00065   __MATHDECL_1(type, function,suffix, args); \
00066   __MATHDECL_1(type, __CONCAT(__,function),suffix, args)
00067 #define __MATHCALLX(function,suffix, args, attrib)      \
00068   __MATHDECLX (_Mdouble_,function,suffix, args, attrib)
00069 #define __MATHDECLX(type, function,suffix, args, attrib) \
00070   __MATHDECL_1(type, function,suffix, args) __attribute__ (attrib); \
00071   __MATHDECL_1(type, __CONCAT(__,function),suffix, args) __attribute__ (attrib)
00072 #define __MATHDECL_1(type, function,suffix, args) \
00073   extern type __MATH_PRECNAME(function,suffix) args __THROW
00074 
00075 #define _Mdouble_               double
00076 #define __MATH_PRECNAME(name,r) __CONCAT(name,r)
00077 // added for gcc-3.2
00078 #define _Mdouble_BEGIN_NAMESPACE __BEGIN_NAMESPACE_STD
00079 #define _Mdouble_END_NAMESPACE   __END_NAMESPACE_STD
00080 // end added for gcc-3.2
00081 #include <bits/mathcalls.h>
00082 #undef  _Mdouble_
00083 // added for gcc-3.2
00084 #undef _Mdouble_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00085 #undef _Mdouble_END_NAMESPACE
00086 // end added for gcc-3.2
00087 #undef  __MATH_PRECNAME
00088 
00089 #if defined __USE_MISC || defined __USE_ISOC99
00090 
00091 
00092 /* Include the file of declarations again, this time using `float'
00093    instead of `double' and appending f to each function name.  */
00094 
00095 # ifndef _Mfloat_
00096 #  define _Mfloat_              float
00097 # endif
00098 # define _Mdouble_              _Mfloat_
00099 # ifdef __STDC__
00100 #  define __MATH_PRECNAME(name,r) name##f##r
00101 # else
00102 #  define __MATH_PRECNAME(name,r) namefr
00103 # endif
00104 // added for gcc-3.2
00105 #define _Mdouble_BEGIN_NAMESPACE __BEGIN_NAMESPACE_C99
00106 #define _Mdouble_END_NAMESPACE   __END_NAMESPACE_C99
00107 // end added for gcc-3.2
00108 # include <bits/mathcalls.h>
00109 # undef _Mdouble_
00110 // added for gcc-3.2
00111 # undef _Mdouble_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00112 # undef _Mdouble_END_NAMESPACE
00113 // end added for gcc-3.2
00114 # undef __MATH_PRECNAME
00115 
00116 # if (__STDC__ - 0 || __GNUC__ - 0) && !defined __NO_LONG_DOUBLE_MATH
00117 /* Include the file of declarations again, this time using `long double'
00118    instead of `double' and appending l to each function name.  */
00119 
00120 #  ifndef _Mlong_double_
00121 #   define _Mlong_double_       long double
00122 #  endif
00123 #  define _Mdouble_             _Mlong_double_
00124 #  ifdef __STDC__
00125 #   define __MATH_PRECNAME(name,r) name##l##r
00126 #  else
00127 #   define __MATH_PRECNAME(name,r) namelr
00128 #  endif
00129 // added for gcc-3.2
00130 #define _Mdouble_BEGIN_NAMESPACE __BEGIN_NAMESPACE_C99
00131 #define _Mdouble_END_NAMESPACE   __END_NAMESPACE_C99
00132 // end added for gcc-3.2
00133 #  include <bits/mathcalls.h>
00134 #  undef _Mdouble_
00135 // added for gcc-3.2
00136 # undef _Mdouble_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00137 # undef _Mdouble_END_NAMESPACE 
00138 // end added for gcc-3.2
00139 #  undef __MATH_PRECNAME
00140 
00141 # endif /* __STDC__ || __GNUC__ */
00142 
00143 #endif  /* Use misc or ISO C99.  */
00144 #undef  __MATHDECL_1
00145 #undef  __MATHDECL
00146 #undef  __MATHCALL

00149 #if defined __USE_MISC || defined __USE_XOPEN
00150 /* This variable is used by `gamma' and `lgamma'.  */
00151 extern int signgam;
00152 #endif

00154 
00155 /* ISO C99 defines some generic macros which work on any data type.  */
00156 #if __USE_ISOC99
00157 
00158 /* Get the architecture specific values describing the floating-point
00159    evaluation.  The following symbols will get defined:
00160 
00161     float_t     floating-point type at least as wide as `float' used
00162                 to evaluate `float' expressions
00163     double_t    floating-point type at least as wide as `double' used
00164                 to evaluate `double' expressions
00165 
00166     FLT_EVAL_METHOD
00167                 Defined to
00168                   0     if `float_t' is `float' and `double_t' is `double'
00169                   1     if `float_t' and `double_t' are `double'
00170                   2     if `float_t' and `double_t' are `long double'
00171                   else  `float_t' and `double_t' are unspecified
00172 
00173     INFINITY    representation of the infinity value of type `float'
00174 
00175     FP_FAST_FMA
00176     FP_FAST_FMAF
00177     FP_FAST_FMAL
00178                 If defined it indicates that the `fma' function
00179                 generally executes about as fast as a multiply and an add.
00180                 This macro is defined only iff the `fma' function is
00181                 implemented directly with a hardware multiply-add instructions.
00182 
00183     FP_ILOGB0   Expands to a value returned by `ilogb (0.0)'.
00184     FP_ILOGBNAN Expands to a value returned by `ilogb (NAN)'.
00185 
00186     DECIMAL_DIG Number of decimal digits supported by conversion between
00187                 decimal and all internal floating-point formats.
00188 
00189 */
00190 
00191 /* All floating-point numbers can be put in one of these categories.  */
00192 enum
00193   {
00194     FP_NAN,
00195 # define FP_NAN FP_NAN
00196     FP_INFINITE,
00197 # define FP_INFINITE FP_INFINITE
00198     FP_ZERO,
00199 # define FP_ZERO FP_ZERO
00200     FP_SUBNORMAL,
00201 # define FP_SUBNORMAL FP_SUBNORMAL
00202     FP_NORMAL
00203 # define FP_NORMAL FP_NORMAL
00204   };
00205 
00206 /* Return number of classification appropriate for X.  */
00207 # ifdef __NO_LONG_DOUBLE_MATH
00208 #  define fpclassify(x) \
00209      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float) ? __fpclassifyf (x) : __fpclassify (x))
00210 # else
00211 #  define fpclassify(x) \
00212      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float)                                            \
00213       ? __fpclassifyf (x)                                                     \
00214       : sizeof (x) == sizeof (double)                                         \
00215       ? __fpclassify (x) : __fpclassifyl (x))
00216 # endif
00217 
00218 /* Return nonzero value if sign of X is negative.  */
00219 # ifdef __NO_LONG_DOUBLE_MATH
00220 #  define signbit(x) \
00221      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float) ? __signbitf (x) : __signbit (x))
00222 # else
00223 #  define signbit(x) \
00224      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float)                                            \
00225       ? __signbitf (x)                                                        \
00226       : sizeof (x) == sizeof (double)                                         \
00227       ? __signbit (x) : __signbitl (x))
00228 # endif
00229 
00230 /* Return nonzero value if X is not +-Inf or NaN.  */
00231 # ifdef __NO_LONG_DOUBLE_MATH
00232 #  define isfinite(x) \
00233      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float) ? __finitef (x) : __finite (x))
00234 # else
00235 #  define isfinite(x) \
00236      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float)                                            \
00237       ? __finitef (x)                                                         \
00238       : sizeof (x) == sizeof (double)                                         \
00239       ? __finite (x) : __finitel (x))
00240 # endif
00241 
00242 /* Return nonzero value if X is neither zero, subnormal, Inf, nor NaN.  */
00243 # define isnormal(x) (fpclassify (x) == FP_NORMAL)
00244 
00245 /* Return nonzero value if X is a NaN.  We could use `fpclassify' but
00246    we already have this functions `__isnan' and it is faster.  */
00247 # ifdef __NO_LONG_DOUBLE_MATH
00248 #  define isnan(x) \
00249      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float) ? __isnanf (x) : __isnan (x))
00250 # else
00251 #  define isnan(x) \
00252      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float)                                            \
00253       ? __isnanf (x)                                                          \
00254       : sizeof (x) == sizeof (double)                                         \
00255       ? __isnan (x) : __isnanl (x))
00256 # endif
00257 
00258 /* Return nonzero value is X is positive or negative infinity.  */
00259 # ifdef __NO_LONG_DOUBLE_MATH
00260 #  define isinf(x) \
00261      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float) ? __isinff (x) : __isinf (x))
00262 # else
00263 #  define isinf(x) \
00264      (sizeof (x) == sizeof (float)                                            \
00265       ? __isinff (x)                                                          \
00266       : sizeof (x) == sizeof (double)                                         \
00267       ? __isinf (x) : __isinfl (x))
00268 # endif
00269 
00270 /* Bitmasks for the math_errhandling macro.  */
00271 # define MATH_ERRNO     1       /* errno set by math functions.  */
00272 # define MATH_ERREXCEPT 2       /* Exceptions raised by math functions.  */
00273 
00274 #endif /* Use ISO C99.  */
00275 
00276 #ifdef  __USE_MISC
00277 /* Support for various different standard error handling behaviors.  */
00278 typedef enum
00279 {
00280   _IEEE_ = -1,  /* According to IEEE 754/IEEE 854.  */
00281   _SVID_,       /* According to System V, release 4.  */
00282   _XOPEN_,      /* Nowadays also Unix98.  */
00283   _POSIX_,
00284   _ISOC_        /* Actually this is ISO C99.  */
00285 } _LIB_VERSION_TYPE;
00286 
00287 /* This variable can be changed at run-time to any of the values above to
00288    affect floating point error handling behavior (it may also be necessary
00289    to change the hardware FPU exception settings).  */
00290 extern _LIB_VERSION_TYPE _LIB_VERSION;
00291 #endif
00292 
00293 
00294 #ifdef __USE_SVID
00295 /* In SVID error handling, `matherr' is called with this description
00296    of the exceptional condition.
00297 
00298    We have a problem when using C++ since `exception' is a reserved
00299    name in C++.  */
00300 # ifdef __cplusplus
00301 struct __exception
00302 # else
00303 struct exception
00304 # endif
00305   {
00306     int type;
00307     char *name;
00308     double arg1;
00309     double arg2;
00310     double retval;
00311   };
00312 
00313 # ifdef __cplusplus
00314 extern int matherr (struct __exception *__exc) throw ();
00315 # else
00316 extern int matherr (struct exception *__exc);
00317 # endif
00318 
00319 # define X_TLOSS        1.41484755040568800000e+16
00320 
00321 /* Types of exceptions in the `type' field.  */
00322 # define DOMAIN         1
00323 # define SING           2
00324 # define OVERFLOW       3
00325 # define UNDERFLOW      4
00326 # define TLOSS          5
00327 # define PLOSS          6
00328 
00329 /* SVID mode specifies returning this large value instead of infinity.  */
00330 # define HUGE           3.40282347e+38F
00331 
00332 #else   /* !SVID */
00333 
00334 # ifdef __USE_XOPEN
00335 /* X/Open wants another strange constant.  */
00336 #  define MAXFLOAT      3.40282347e+38F
00337 # endif
00338 
00339 #endif  /* SVID */
00340

00342 /* Some useful constants.  */
00343 #if defined __USE_BSD || defined __USE_XOPEN
00344 # define M_E            2.7182818284590452354   /* e */
00345 # define M_LOG2E        1.4426950408889634074   /* log_2 e */
00346 # define M_LOG10E       0.43429448190325182765  /* log_10 e */
00347 # define M_LN2          0.69314718055994530942  /* log_e 2 */
00348 # define M_LN10         2.30258509299404568402  /* log_e 10 */
00349 # define M_PI           3.14159265358979323846  /* pi */
00350 # define M_PI_2         1.57079632679489661923  /* pi/2 */
00351 # define M_PI_4         0.78539816339744830962  /* pi/4 */
00352 # define M_1_PI         0.31830988618379067154  /* 1/pi */
00353 # define M_2_PI         0.63661977236758134308  /* 2/pi */
00354 # define M_2_SQRTPI     1.12837916709551257390  /* 2/sqrt(pi) */
00355 # define M_SQRT2        1.41421356237309504880  /* sqrt(2) */
00356 # define M_SQRT1_2      0.70710678118654752440  /* 1/sqrt(2) */
00357 #endif
00358 
00359 /* The above constants are not adequate for computation using `long double's.
00360    Therefore we provide as an extension constants with similar names as a
00361    GNU extension.  Provide enough digits for the 128-bit IEEE quad.  */
00362 #ifdef __USE_GNU
00363 # define M_El           2.7182818284590452353602874713526625L  /* e */
00364 # define M_LOG2El       1.4426950408889634073599246810018922L  /* log_2 e */
00365 # define M_LOG10El      0.4342944819032518276511289189166051L  /* log_10 e */
00366 # define M_LN2l         0.6931471805599453094172321214581766L  /* log_e 2 */
00367 # define M_LN10l        2.3025850929940456840179914546843642L  /* log_e 10 */
00368 # define M_PIl          3.1415926535897932384626433832795029L  /* pi */
00369 # define M_PI_2l        1.5707963267948966192313216916397514L  /* pi/2 */
00370 # define M_PI_4l        0.7853981633974483096156608458198757L  /* pi/4 */
00371 # define M_1_PIl        0.3183098861837906715377675267450287L  /* 1/pi */
00372 # define M_2_PIl        0.6366197723675813430755350534900574L  /* 2/pi */
00373 # define M_2_SQRTPIl    1.1283791670955125738961589031215452L  /* 2/sqrt(pi) */
00374 # define M_SQRT2l       1.4142135623730950488016887242096981L  /* sqrt(2) */
00375 # define M_SQRT1_2l     0.7071067811865475244008443621048490L  /* 1/sqrt(2) */
00376 #endif

00379 /* When compiling in strict ISO C compatible mode we must not use the
00380    inline functions since they, among other things, do not set the
00381    `errno' variable correctly.  */
00382 #if defined __STRICT_ANSI__ && !defined __NO_MATH_INLINES
00383 # define __NO_MATH_INLINES      1
00384 #endif
00385 
00386 /* Get machine-dependent inline versions (if there are any).  */
00387 #ifdef __USE_EXTERN_INLINES
00388 # include <bits/mathinline.h>
00389 #endif
00390 
00391 
00392 #if __USE_ISOC99
00393 /* ISO C99 defines some macros to compare number while taking care
00394    for unordered numbers.  Since many FPUs provide special
00395    instructions to support these operations and these tests are
00396    defined in <bits/mathinline.h>, we define the generic macros at
00397    this late point and only if they are not defined yet.  */
00398 
00399 /* Return nonzero value if X is greater than Y.  */
00400 # ifndef isgreater
00401 #  define isgreater(x, y) \
00402   (__extension__                                                              \
00403    ({ __typeof__(x) __x = (x); __typeof__(y) __y = (y);                       \
00404       !isunordered (__x, __y) && __x > __y; }))
00405 # endif
00406 
00407 /* Return nonzero value if X is greater than or equal to Y.  */
00408 # ifndef isgreaterequal
00409 #  define isgreaterequal(x, y) \
00410   (__extension__                                                              \
00411    ({ __typeof__(x) __x = (x); __typeof__(y) __y = (y);                       \
00412       !isunordered (__x, __y) && __x >= __y; }))
00413 # endif
00414 
00415 /* Return nonzero value if X is less than Y.  */
00416 # ifndef isless
00417 #  define isless(x, y) \
00418   (__extension__                                                              \
00419    ({ __typeof__(x) __x = (x); __typeof__(y) __y = (y);                       \
00420       !isunordered (__x, __y) && __x < __y; }))
00421 # endif
00422 
00423 /* Return nonzero value if X is less than or equal to Y.  */
00424 # ifndef islessequal
00425 #  define islessequal(x, y) \
00426   (__extension__                                                              \
00427    ({ __typeof__(x) __x = (x); __typeof__(y) __y = (y);                       \
00428       !isunordered (__x, __y) && __x <= __y; }))
00429 # endif
00430 
00431 /* Return nonzero value if either X is less than Y or Y is less than X.  */
00432 # ifndef islessgreater
00433 #  define islessgreater(x, y) \
00434   (__extension__                                                              \
00435    ({ __typeof__(x) __x = (x); __typeof__(y) __y = (y);                       \
00436       !isunordered (__x, __y) && (__x < __y || __y < __x); }))
00437 # endif
00438 
00439 /* Return nonzero value if arguments are unordered.  */
00440 # ifndef isunordered
00441 #  define isunordered(u, v) \
00442   (__extension__                                                              \
00443    ({ __typeof__(u) __u = (u); __typeof__(v) __v = (v);                       \
00444       fpclassify (__u) == FP_NAN || fpclassify (__v) == FP_NAN; }))
00445 # endif
00446 
00447 #endif
00448 
00449 __END_DECLS
